explanation:
Correct calculation: Area = base × perpendicular height = 5 cm × 4 cm = 20 cm².

Student's error: 5 cm × 6 cm = 30 cm².

The student multiplied the base by the slant length instead of the perpendicular height. This indicates they confused the non-perpendicular side length with the vertical height required for area calculation. The misconception caused them to select the visually prominent 6 cm slant edge rather than the 4 cm height marked perpendicular to the base. This distinguishes from perimeter errors (which would sum sides) and trapezium-related errors (which involve misapplying parallel side pairs). The error stems from misidentifying which measurement represents the true height in the area formula.
